solution_line_template: Jen did {jen_triple_flips} triple-flips, so she did {jen_triple_flips} * {flips_per_triple_flip} = <<{jen_triple_flips}*{flips_per_triple_flip}={jen_total_flips}>>{jen_total_flips} flips.
Tyler did half the number of flips, so he did {jen_total_flips} / {half_divisor} = <<{jen_total_flips}/{half_divisor}={tyler_total_flips}>>{tyler_total_flips} flips.
A double flip has two flips, so Tyler did {tyler_total_flips} / {flips_per_double_flip} = <<{tyler_total_flips}/{flips_per_double_flip}={tyler_double_flips}>>{tyler_double_flips} double-flips.
